lines.text: Now listen mate, I need to splash the boots. You know, strain the potatoes. Water the horses. You know, go where the big knobs hang out. Shake hands with the wife's best friend? Drain the dragon? Siphon the python? Ring the rattlesnake? You know, unbutton the mutton? Like, point Percy at the porcelain?
I think he wants to go to the loo.
Don't come the raw prawn with me!
Lesley, I don't know where we went wrong... I'm sure it was 50% your fault...

[reading from newspaper]
"I had six pints of Guinness and everything went black..."
You're going to break a few hearts tonight. Just let your Auntie whisk off your cradle-cap, and pick out those little custard corners.
What a delightfully refreshing traditional old English meal that was, Mrs Gort
And how unusual to serve the spaghetti bolognese without the toast.
